description:
Has American pressure on Labour over free speech paid off? An unexpectedly robust statement about academic freedom from Bridget Phillipson this week suggests it may well have, says Julian Mann.

The post Is Labour Bending to US Pressure on Free Speech? appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Is Labour Bending to US Pressure on Free Speech?

description:
Air travel will soon be the preserve of the privileged, an airline boss has admitted, as Net Zero makes low-cost air travel a thing of the past. The truth the Net Zero is making us poorer is slowly leaking out.

The post Net Zero Will Make Air Travel the Preserve of the Privileged, Airline Boss Admits appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Net Zero Will Make Air Travel the Preserve of the Privileged, Airline Boss Admits

description:
Just Stop Oil has announced that it will end its campaign of disruptive protests as it claimed Ed Miliband has made its main demand of no new oil and gas "Government policy".

The post Just Stop Oil Announces End of Protests After Miliband “Made Demands Government Policy” appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Just Stop Oil Announces End of Protests After Miliband “Made Demands Government Policy”

description:
96% of US law professors are Democrat donors. It's a reflection of how extreme the anti-conservative bias in the law profession has become, says Ramesh Thakur. How can we hold politically biased judges to account?

The post Who Will Hold Politically Biased Judges to Account? appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Who Will Hold Politically Biased Judges to Account?

description:
Now the Sentencing Council plans to slash the penalties for illegally entering the UK, making deportations far harder. It's almost as though the judiciary has been captured by an unaccountable Leftist cabal.

The post Now the Sentencing Council Waters Down Penalties for Illegally Entering the UK, Making Deportations Far Harder appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Now the Sentencing Council Waters Down Penalties for Illegally Entering the UK, Making Deportations Far Harder

description:
On July 19th 2022 the Met Office claimed a new UK record of 40.3°C in two locations – both of them busy RAF stations. The Met Office itself called one of them 'suspect', but it has now entered the long-term archive.

The post 40.3°C UK Temperature ‘Record’ from Halfway Down Airport Runway Enters the Long-Term Archive appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: 40.3°C UK Temperature ‘Record’ from Halfway Down Airport Runway Enters the Long-Term Archive

description:
Thousands of ecologists face losing their jobs due to Labour's planning reforms. Does this mean the nature-lovers might finally turn against land-hungry and bird-massacring renewables, wonders Ben Pile.

The post Will the Thousands of Ecologists Put Out of Work by Labour’s Planning Reforms Finally Turn on Bird-Massacring Renewables? appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Will the Thousands of Ecologists Put Out of Work by Labour’s Planning Reforms Finally Turn on Bird-Massacring Renewables?

description:
A summary of the most interesting stories in the past 24 hours that challenge the prevailing orthodoxy about the ‘climate emergency’, public health ‘crises’ and the supposed moral defects of Western civilisation.

The post News Round-Up appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: News Round-Up
